exclusion: Triple click the button. Success is indicated by a green LED blinking for one second plus two short beeps by the buzzer.
inclusion:
When using Smart start just scan the QR code on your device.

When using classical Z-Wave inclusion, triple click the button. Success is indicated by a green LED blinking for one second plus two short beeps by the buzzer.
label: BVSZWE01
overview:
The BVS (Ball Valve Servo) is a motor to retrofit existing and installed ball valves into smart water controlling devices. Its wireless communication capabilities are compatible with several industry standards (Lora, Z-Wave, ULE) for easy integration into existing networks. The motor is powered by a 12 V external power supply or - optional – a battery block.

The variable clamps allow mounting even in complex pipe installations. The patented motor coupling ensures easy installation and precise long-term operation. The device can operate in difficult environmental conditions, even submerged under water and allows to directly connect one additional local water sensor pad by cable.

category.label: Valve
category.description: Valves used to control water or gas. e.g. a flow stop valve.

parameters.label: Water Valve Report Value
parameters.description: This parameter defines how the water valve position is reported.
parameters.overview:
0 Normal

1 Reversed

parameters.label: Command Sent into Association Group 2 on ON
parameters.description: Defines what BASIC command Value to send into Association Group 2
parameters.overview:
0 Disabled

1 Enabled Basic On (0xff)

2 Enabled, Basic Off (0x00)

parameters.label: Command Sent into Association Group 2 on OFF
parameters.description: Defines what BASIC command Value to send into Association Group 2
parameters.overview:
0 Disabled

1 Enabled Basic On (0xff)

2 Enabled, Basic Off (0x00)

parameters.label: Temperature Sensor Report
parameters.description: Defines if and how a temperature value is reported.
parameters.overview:
0 Disabled

1 Report in Celsius

2 Report in Fahrenheit

parameters.label: Temperature Sensor Report Threshold
parameters.description: Defines the change in temperature value to cause unsolicited sending of an report.
parameters.overview:
0x00-0xff Value in Celsius (Example: 0x02 = 2 C)

0x100-0x1ff Value in Fahrenheit (Example: 0x102 = 2 F)

parameters.label: Temperature Sensor Report Offset
parameters.description: Defines a temperature offset for the reported temperature. This parameter can be used to compensate for certain temperature deviations.
parameters.overview:
0x00-0xff Positive Deviation in Celsius (e.g. 0x02 = +2 C)

0x1000-0x10ff Negative Deviation in Celsius (e.g. 0x02 = -2 C)

0x0100-0x01ff Positive Deviation in Fahrenheit (e.g. 0x02 = +2 F)

0x1100-0x11ff Negative Deviation in Fahrenheit (e.g. 0x02 = -2 F)

parameters.label: Temperature Overheat Trigger
parameters.description: Sets the temperature to trigger and overheat alarm and
parameters.overview:
0x00-0xff Value in Celsius (example: 0x02 = 2 C)

0x100-0x1ff Value in Fahrenheit (Example: 0x102 = 2 F)

parameters.label: Temperature Overhead Reset Trigger Value
parameters.description: Sets the temperature to reset the overheat alarm and
parameters.overview:
0x00-0xff Value in Celsius (Example: 0x02 = 2 C)

0x100-0x1ff Value in Fahrenheit (Example: 0x102 = 2 F)

parameters.label: Temperature Overhead Action Value
parameters.description: Defines what BASIC command Value to send into Association Group 4
parameters.overview:
0 Disabled

1 Enabled Basic On (0xff)

2 Enabled, Basic Off (0x00)

parameters.label: Temperature Overhead Action Reset Value
parameters.description: Defines what BASIC command Value to send into Association Group 4
parameters.overview:
0 Disabled

1 Enabled Basic On (0xff)

2 Enabled, Basic Off (0x00)

parameters.label: Freeze Trigger Value
parameters.description: Sets the temperature threshold to cause a freeze alarm
parameters.overview:
0x00-0xff Value in Celsius (Example: 0x02 = 2 C)

0x100-0x1ff Value in Fahrenheit (Example: 0x102 = 2 F)

parameters.label: Freeze Trigger Reset Value
parameters.description: Sets the temperature threshold to reset a freeze alarm
parameters.overview:
0x00-0xff Value in Celsius (Example: 0x02 = 2 C)

0x100-0x1ff Value in Fahrenheit (Example: 0x102 = 2 F)

parameters.label: Freeze Valve Action
parameters.description: This parameter defines If detected freezing shall close the valve
parameters.overview:
0 Disabled

1 Enabled

parameters.description: Defines what BASIC command Value to send into Association Group 5
parameters.overview:
0 Disabled

1 Enabled Basic On (0xff)

2 Enabled, Basic Off (0x00)

parameters.label: Freeze Association Reset Command
parameters.description: Defines what BASIC command Value to send into Association Group 5
parameters.overview:
0 Disabled

1 Enabled Basic On (0xff)

0 Disabled

1 Enabled Basic On (0xff)

0 Disabled

0 Disabled

parameters.overview: 0-100 Brightness level

1 Overheat Report

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.description: Lifeline. All alarms that shall be sent to the gateway

associations.description: Switch Devices when Water Valve is operated (either local or by sensor o by wireless command)

associations.description: Switch Devices when water leak was detected

associations.description: Switch Devices when temperature raise above threshold

associations.label: Switch on temperature too low
